ygData.subject: reincarnation time
ygData.msgSnippet: hiya, just killing time at work so i figured i d ask this question.  First off let me state that my main character is a necro, lev 52 and that my bard lev 36
ygData.messageBody:
hiya, just killing time at work so i figured i'd ask this question. First
off let me state that my main character is a necro, lev 52 and that my bard
lev 36 has been on the shelf for over 6 months. I dunno about all of you but
i find 50+ levels to be extremely depressing, i feel like im taking one step
forward 2 steps back. I find that in general all classes become extremely
powerfull over 50 but its brain numbing repetition. I been playing my little
warrior (almost 14 with 400hp weeee). Its kinda cool to play a warrior, i
did 2 crippling blows in a row for 96 dmg to a kodiak at lev 12, i was in
shock.

But anyways, the reason im writing this is because im thinking of restarting
my bard, but he's nekked (i stripped him when i started my necro). You have
anything that you could suggest to re-equip with that is easy to obtain with
my big boy necro? i need armor and weapons. He's got lambent arms or bracer
still, and shin pants and gloves and his mask still, and i think he has a
barbute too, not sure. I was thinkin of goin to guk to get a carapace maybe
for a bp till i get him something better. Any suggestions of something i can
solo easily with my necro to give to him? and weapons.... all i have is a
fs long sword hehe (if only my wakizashies on my ranger were not no drop).
maybe i could go terrorize the avatar of fear or something, but im hoping to
avoid the claw. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated as i think its
time to take the dust off that old drummer boy. I think i'd like to go to
hate one day with that bard

Your opinions/suggestions will not be taken lightly and will be greatly
appreciated

-Rakka 52 Dark elf Heretic
-Minkin 36 wood-elf Bard
-Tanqueray 14 half-elf warrior

"Nothing in the world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not;
nothing is more common than unsuccessful men with talent. Genius will not;
unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. Education alone will not; the world
is full of educated derelicts. Persistence and determination alone are
omnipotent." --Calvin Coolidge
